00151 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long ns,
00152                                       void (*tickhandler)(void))
00153 {
00154     int err = rthal_timer_request(tickhandler,ns);
00155     rthal_declare_cpuid;
00156     long long delta;
00157 
00158     if (err)
00159         return err;
00160 
00161     rthal_load_cpuid();
00162     delta = rthal_itm_next[cpuid] - ia64_get_itc();
00163     
00164     return delta < 0LL ? 0LL : xnarch_tsc_to_ns(delta);
00165 }

00167 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00168 
00169 {
00170     struct task_struct *fpu_owner
00171         = (struct task_struct *)ia64_get_kr(IA64_KR_FPU_OWNER);
00172     rthal_declare_cpuid;
00173 
00174     rthal_load_cpuid();
00175 
00176     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00177     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00178     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_root_host_task(cpuid);
00179     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00180     rootcb->fpup = fpu_owner ? fpu_owner->thread.fph : NULL;
00181     rootcb->kspp = &current->thread.ksp;
00182 }

00184 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00185 {
00186     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00187 }

00189 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00190                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00191 {
00192     struct task_struct *prev = out_tcb->active_task;
00193     struct task_struct *next = in_tcb->user_task;
00194 
00195     in_tcb->active_task = next ?: prev;
00196 
00197     if (next && next != prev)
00198         {
00199         /* We are switching to a user task different from the last
00200            preempted or running user task, so that we can use the
00201            Linux context switch routine. */
00202         struct mm_struct *oldmm = prev->active_mm;
00203 
00204         switch_mm(oldmm,next->active_mm,next);
00205 
00206         if (!next->mm)
00207             enter_lazy_tlb(oldmm,next);
00208 
00209         if (IA64_HAS_EXTRA_STATE(prev))
00210                 ia64_save_extra(prev);
00211 
00212         if (IA64_HAS_EXTRA_STATE(next))
00213                 ia64_load_extra(next);
00214 
00215         ia64_psr(ia64_task_regs(next))->dfh = !ia64_is_local_fpu_owner(next);
00216 
00217         rthal_thread_switch(out_tcb->kspp,in_tcb->kspp,1);
00218         }
00219     else
00220         {
00221         unsigned long gp;
00222 
00223         ia64_stop();
00224         gp = ia64_getreg(_IA64_REG_GP);
00225         ia64_stop();
00226         rthal_thread_switch(out_tcb->kspp,in_tcb->kspp,0);
00227         ia64_stop();
00228         ia64_setreg(_IA64_REG_GP, gp);
00229         ia64_stop();
00230 
00231         /* fph will be enabled by xnarch_restore_fpu if needed, and
00232            returns the root thread in its usual mode. */
00233         ia64_fph_disable();
00234         }
00235 }

00249 #define fph2task(faddr)                                 \
00250     ((struct task_struct *)((char *) (faddr) -          \
00251                             (size_t) &((struct task_struct *) 0)->thread.fph[0]))
00252 
00253 #define xnarch_fpu_init_p(task) ((task)->thread.flags & IA64_THREAD_FPH_VALID)
00254 
00255 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00256 
00257 {
00258     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00259     /* Initialize the FPU for a task. This must be run on behalf of the
00260        task. */
00261     ia64_fph_enable();
00262     __ia64_init_fpu();
00263     /* The mfh bit is automatically armed, since the init_fpu routine
00264        modifies the FPH registers. */
00265 
00266     if(task)
00267         /* Real-time shadow FPU initialization: setting the mfh bit in saved
00268           registers, xnarch_save_fpu will finish the work. Since tcb is the tcb
00269           of a shadow, no need to check: task == fph2task(tcb->fpup). */
00270         ia64_psr(ia64_task_regs(task))->mfh = 1;
00271 }
00272 
00273 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00274 {
00275     unsigned long lpsr = ia64_getreg(_IA64_REG_PSR);
00276     struct ia64_psr *current_psr = (struct ia64_psr *) &lpsr;
00277     
00278     if (current_psr->mfh)
00279         {
00280         if(tcb->user_task && tcb->fpup)
00281             {
00282             struct task_struct *linux_fpu_owner = fph2task(tcb->fpup);
00283             struct ia64_psr *psr = ia64_psr(ia64_task_regs(linux_fpu_owner));
00284 
00285             /* Keep the FPU save zone in sync with what Linux expects. */
00286             psr->mfh = 0;
00287             linux_fpu_owner->thread.flags |= IA64_THREAD_FPH_VALID;
00288             }
00289 
00290         ia64_fph_enable();
00291         __ia64_save_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00292         ia64_rsm(IA64_PSR_MFH);
00293         ia64_srlz_d();
00294         }
00295 }
00296 
00297 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00298 
00299 {
00300     struct task_struct *linux_fpu_owner;
00301     int need_disabled_fph;
00302 
00303     if (tcb->user_task && tcb->fpup)
00304         {
00305         linux_fpu_owner = fph2task(tcb->fpup);
00306 
00307         if(!xnarch_fpu_init_p(linux_fpu_owner))
00308             return;     /* Uninit fpu area -- do not restore. */
00309 
00310         /* Disable fph, if we are not switching back to the task which
00311            owns the FPU. */
00312         need_disabled_fph = linux_fpu_owner != tcb->user_task;
00313         }
00314     else
00315         need_disabled_fph = 0;
00316 
00317     /* Restore the FPU hardware with valid fp registers from a
00318        user-space or kernel thread. */
00319     ia64_fph_enable();
00320     __ia64_load_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00321     ia64_rsm(IA64_PSR_MFH);
00322     ia64_srlz_d();
00323 
00324     if(need_disabled_fph)
00325         ia64_fph_disable();
00326 }
00327

00329 static inline void xnarch_enable_fpu(xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00330 {
00331     if (tcb->user_task && tcb->fpup && fph2task(tcb->fpup) != tcb->user_task)
00332         return;
00333 
00334     ia64_fph_enable();
00335 }

00348 static void xnarch_thread_trampoline (struct xnthread *self,
00349                                       int imask,
00350                                       void(*entry)(void *),
00351                                       void *cookie)
00352 {
00353     /* xnpod_welcome_thread() will do ia64_fpu_enable() if needed. */
00354     ia64_fph_disable();
00355     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!imask);
00356     rthal_local_irq_enable_hw();
00357     xnpod_welcome_thread(self);
00358     entry(cookie);
00359     xnpod_delete_thread(self);
00360 }

00362 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00363                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00364                                        void *cookie,
00365                                        int imask,
00366                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00367                                        char *name)
00368 {
00369     unsigned long rbs,bspstore,child_stack,child_rbs,rbs_size;
00370     unsigned long stackbase = (unsigned long) tcb->stackbase;
00371     struct switch_stack *swstack;    
00372 
00373     tcb->ksp = 0;
00374     tcb->name = name;
00375 
00376     /* The stack should have already been allocated. */
00377     rthal_prepare_stack(stackbase+KERNEL_STACK_SIZE);
00378 
00379     /* The value of ksp is used as a marker to indicate whether we are
00380        initializing a new task or we are back from the context
00381        switch. */
00382 
00383     if (tcb->ksp != 0)
00384         /* The following statement must be first. */
00385         xnarch_thread_trampoline(thread, imask, entry, cookie);
00386 
00387     child_stack = stackbase + KERNEL_STACK_SIZE - IA64_SWITCH_STACK_SIZE;
00388     tcb->ksp = child_stack;
00389     swstack = (struct switch_stack *)child_stack;
00390     bspstore = swstack->ar_bspstore;
00391 
00392     rbs = (ia64_getreg(_IA64_REG_SP) & ~(KERNEL_STACK_SIZE-1)) + IA64_RBS_OFFSET;
00393     child_rbs = stackbase + IA64_RBS_OFFSET;
00394     rbs_size = bspstore - rbs;
00395 
00396     memcpy((void *)child_rbs,(void *)rbs,rbs_size);
00397     swstack->ar_bspstore = child_rbs + rbs_size;
00398     tcb->ksp -= 16 ;    /* Provide for the (bloody) scratch area... */
00399 }

00444 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (rthal_pipeline_stage_t *ipd, int cpuid)
00445 
00446 {
00447     unsigned irq;
00448 
00449     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00450         {
00451         unsigned vector = __ia64_local_vector_to_irq(irq);
00452 
00453         switch (vector)
00454             {
00455 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00456             case RTHAL_CRITICAL_VECTOR:
00457             case IA64_IPI_RESCHEDULE:
00458             case IA64_IPI_VECTOR:
00459 
00460                 /* Never lock out these ones. */
00461                 continue;
00462 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00463 
00464             default:
00465 
00466                 rthal_lock_irq(ipd,cpuid,irq);
00467             }
00468         }
00469 }

00558 unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00559 
00560 {
00561 #if CONFIG_XENO_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00562     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_XENO_HW_TIMER_LATENCY);
00563 #else /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00564     /* Compute the time needed to program the ITM in aperiodic
00565        mode. The return value is expressed in CPU ticks. */

00567 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00568 }

00571

00580     return 0;

00583 static inline void stacksq_push(xnarch_stack_t *q, xnarch_stack_t *stack)
00584 {
00585     stack->next = q->next;

00589 static inline xnarch_stack_t *stacksq_pop(xnarch_stack_t *q)
00590 {
00591     xnarch_stack_t *stack = q->next;
00592 
00593     if(stack)
00594         q->next = stack->next;
00595

00599 int xnarch_alloc_stack(xnarchtcb_t *tcb, unsigned stacksize)
00600 
00601 {
00602     xnarch_stack_t *stack;
00603     spl_t s;
00604 
00605     if (stacksize > KERNEL_STACK_SIZE)
00606         return -EINVAL;
00607 
00608     tcb->stacksize = stacksize;
00609 
00610     if (stacksize == 0) {
00611         tcb->stackbase = NULL;
00612         return 0;
00613     }
00614 
00615     stacksize = KERNEL_STACK_SIZE; /* No matter what, this is what you
00616                                       will have on this arch. */
00617 
00618     if (rthal_current_domain == rthal_root_domain &&
00619         atomic_read(&xnarch_free_stacks_count) <= CONFIG_XENO_HW_IA64_STACK_POOL)
00620         {
00621         stack = (xnarch_stack_t *)
00622             __get_free_pages(GFP_KERNEL,KERNEL_STACK_SIZE_ORDER);
00623 
00624         if(stack)
00625             atomic_inc(&xnarch_allocated_stacks);
00626 
00627         goto done;
00628         }
00629 
00630     xnlock_get_irqsave(&xnarch_stacks_lock, s);
00631     stack = stacksq_pop(&xnarch_free_stacks_q);
00632     xnlock_put_irqrestore(&xnarch_stacks_lock, s);
00633 
00634     if (stack)
00635         atomic_dec(&xnarch_free_stacks_count);
00636 
00637  done:
00638 
00639     tcb->stackbase = stack;
00640 
00641     return stack ? 0 : -ENOMEM;
00642 }
00643 
00644 void xnarch_free_stack(xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00645 
00646 {
00647     xnarch_stack_t *stack = tcb->stackbase;
00648     spl_t s;
00649 
00650     if (!stack)
00651         return;
00652 
00653     if (rthal_current_domain == rthal_root_domain
00654         && atomic_read(&xnarch_free_stacks_count) > CONFIG_XENO_HW_IA64_STACK_POOL)
00655         {
00656         atomic_dec(&xnarch_allocated_stacks);
00657         free_pages((unsigned long) stack,KERNEL_STACK_SIZE_ORDER);
00658         return;
00659         }
00660 
00661     xnlock_get_irqsave(&xnarch_stacks_lock, s);
00662     stacksq_push(&xnarch_free_stacks_q, stack);
00663     xnlock_put_irqrestore(&xnarch_stacks_lock, s);
00664     
00665     atomic_inc(&xnarch_free_stacks_count);
00666 }
00667 
00668 static int xnarch_stack_pool_init(void)
00669 
00670 {
00671     while (atomic_read(&xnarch_free_stacks_count) < CONFIG_XENO_HW_IA64_STACK_POOL)
00672         {
00673         xnarchtcb_t tcb; /* Fake TCB only to allocate and recycle stacks. */
00674 
00675         if (xnarch_alloc_stack(&tcb,KERNEL_STACK_SIZE))
00676             return -ENOMEM;
00677 
00678         xnarch_free_stack(&tcb);
00679         }
00680 
00681     return 0;
00682 }
00683 
00684 static void xnarch_stack_pool_destroy(void)
00685 
00686 {
00687     xnarch_stack_t *stack;
00688 
00689     stack = stacksq_pop(&xnarch_free_stacks_q);
00690 
00691     while (stack)
00692         {
00693         free_pages((unsigned long) stack, KERNEL_STACK_SIZE_ORDER);
00694         stack = stacksq_pop(&xnarch_free_stacks_q);
00695 
00696         if(atomic_dec_and_test(&xnarch_allocated_stacks))
00697             break;
00698         }
00699 
00700     if (atomic_read(&xnarch_allocated_stacks) != 0)
00701         xnarch_logwarn("leaked %u kernel threads stacks.\n",
00702                        atomic_read(&xnarch_allocated_stacks));
00703 
00704     if (xnarch_free_stacks_q.next)
00705         xnarch_logwarn("kernel threads stacks pool corrupted.\n");
00706 }

00708 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00709 
00710 {
00711     int err;
00712 
00713 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00714     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00715        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00716     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00717 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00718 
00719     err = xnarch_calibrate_sched();
00720 
00721     if (err)
00722         return err;
00723 
00724     xnarch_escalation_virq = rthal_alloc_virq();
00725 
00726     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
00727         return -ENOSYS;
00728 
00729     rthal_virtualize_irq(&rthal_domain,
00730                          xnarch_escalation_virq,
00731                          (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
00732                          NULL,
00733                          IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00734 
00735     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_trap_catch(&xnarch_trap_fault);
00736 
00737 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PERVASIVE
00738     err = xnshadow_mount();
00739 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PERVASIVE */
00740 
00741     if (err)
00742         goto release_trap;
00743 
00744     err = xnarch_stack_pool_init();
00745 
00746     if (!err)
00747         return 0;
00748 
00749 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PERVASIVE
00750     xnshadow_cleanup();
00751 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PERVASIVE */
00752 
00753  release_trap:
00754     rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00755     rthal_free_virq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00756 
00757     return err;
00758 }

00762 {

00764     xnshadow_cleanup();

00766     rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00767     rthal_free_virq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00768     xnarch_stack_pool_destroy();
